file name: jetty-6.1.26.jar NOTE: There is a transitive dependency with a known vulnerability exists, but it is not exposed. The Log4J Flume Appender is an event driven Flume Source that is supported by the Highly Efficient Record Processor (HERP) filter to send event data to a remote Flume Agent. The Log4J Flume Appender is not pollable even though it depends on the flume-ng-sdk which does support that type of source. Therefore the transitive dependency on an old Jetty version with a known vulnerability that is used to support polling does not expose the potential DOS attack vector in this instance.

file name: jython-standalone-2.7.1.jar NOTE: This is being fixed under issue https://bugs.jython.org/issue2728 This is currently only potentially exposed if the Scripting filter is used with Python to deserialize certain data types. Fixing the log4j transitive dependency from jena-iri module and update log4j version in this release. This will be fixed in a later release.

file name: jython-standalone-2.7.1.jar/META-INF/maven/com.google.guava/guava/pom.xml NOTE: This is being fixed under issue https://bugs.jython.org/issue2728 This is currently only potentially exposed if the Scripting filter is used with Python to deserialize certain data types. Fixing the log4j transitive dependency from jena-iri module and update log4j version in this release. This will be fixed in a later release.

file name: slf4j-ext-1.6.3.jar NOTE: The dependency which includes this issue is a transitive dependency inherited from com.atlassian.oai:swagger-request-validator-core. The issue in question is in the constructor of the EventData class, which is never invoked by Repose or any of its transitive dependencies. As such, this issue is inaccessible to Repose users.

file name: jetty-(servlet|security|io|server|http|util)-9.4.14.v20181114.jar NOTE: This vulnerability is only exposed if the DefaultServlet or ResourceHandler are used with indexing/listing enabled. Since Repose doesn't use these normally default classes, this issue does not effect Repose users.
file name: jackson-core-2.9.10.jar NOTE: Fixing the log4j transitive dependency from jena-iri module and update log4j version in this release. This will be fixed in a later release.

file name: jackson-databind-2.9.10.jar & jackson-databind-2.12.5.jar NOTE: Fixing the log4j transitive dependency from jena-iri module and update log4j version in this release. This will be fixed in a later release.
file name: spring-web-5.3.32.jar This will be fixed in a later release.
file name: jetty-util-6.1.26.jar NOTE: Misidentified as Jetty itself.

file name: jython-standalone-2.7.1.jar (shaded: org.apache.commons:commons-compress:1.14) This dependency gets shaded into the jython library used by the scripting filter. We don't consume zips from the user, but a scripting filter could be written to do, so the vulnerability will be documented.

file name: commons-compress-1.4.1.jar This dependency gets shaded into the jython library used by the scripting filter. We don't consume zips from the user, but a scripting filter could be written to do, so the vulnerability will be documented.
file name: netty-3.10.6.Final.jar This vulnerability is for when using netty as a server, for us it's being used transitive for flume and even in that capacity it's a client not a server.
file name: velocity-1.7.jar This is being used transitive for flume.
file name: apache-mime4j-core-0.7.2.jar
file name: akka-actor_2.12-2.9.0-M1.jar
